intro: Trollius vitalii, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of hairs. Trollius vitalii thrives in well-drained, sandy or loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
